text: this is Bill Cunningham reporting from
the battlefield of New York Fashion Week
and what madness and on top of it of
course we had the snow many of the women
going to the shows never gave up their
high heels and of course as it always
happens the following day it warms up or
two days later and you have everyone
jumping over slush water piles hit the
curbs
but I think of all the wonderful sights
in style of dress that people wore and
we'll see in following weeks
what's the attention to the foot not
only because of the inclement weather
the absolutely obsession with shoes and
interestingly enough the fashion week
opened with an exhibit of extreme
over-the-top shoes at the Museum of the
Fashion Institute of Technology
obviously these were meant to be worn
but it shows you the when the fashion
world's imagination focuses on a
particular part of the body whether it's
coats dresses sweaters jackets hats
whatever it is you can just you can't
imagine what they concoct oh oh and
before I forget it look at Iris Apfel
who's 90 all in red and a show and look
what she had on she had coordinated her
clothes with red LL Bean duck shoes now
I mean that's the fashion world not just
any dump shoe they had to be color
correct so have fun with it
the erogenous zone if you will in
fashion and there always is one is
definitely on the foot
